definition: hereditary benefits such as rank and wealth

sentences.english: The hereditary laurels system and the family bureaucrat system are interdependence with each other in the pre-qin period.
sentences.chinese: 先秦时代的世禄制度与世官制度是相互依存的。

sentences.english: The second part, mainly inquired into causes reason which the hereditary laurels system declines.
sentences.chinese: 第二部分，主要探究了导致世禄制度衰落的原因。

definition: father's elder brother/senior/paternal elder uncle/eldest of brothers/respectful form of address/Count, third of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]
numerous/common people (or populace)/born of a concubine
to confer a title/to ennoble/to knight/title of nobility
to give in to/to be swayed by (personal considerations etc)/Taiwan pr. [xun2]/to follow/to expose publicly/variant of 侚[xun4]/variant of 殉[xun4]
Great Ancestor (posthumous title, e.g. for the founder of a dynasty)

public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)
